Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior, tondo framed by band of alternate red and black tongues with white dots in interstices, between bands of staggered dots; in tondo, male figure's right foot, to right; exterior glazed with one reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.430 according to Robertson, though a stacking ring on 430 does not appear here.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 8)
Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 146, no. 6, fig. 2; p. 147, no. 6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 383, no. B539)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556 no. G12)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 231, no. 6b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1545) (phase 3)
